titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Brooklyn Eagle profiles of Brooklyn's six original towns ARC.249
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:14:05 +0000.

did.unittitle: Brooklyn Eagle profiles of Brooklyn's six original towns
did.abstract: Several supplements from 1946 Sunday issues of the Brooklyn Eagle containing profiles of the borough of Brooklyn's six original towns, including Brooklyn, Bushwick, Flatbush, Flatlands, Gravesend, and New Utrecht. Profiles detail each town's history, churches, homes, schools, and other notable buildings and monuments. An historical profile of the neighborhood of Williamsburg is also included. Two booklets, published circa 1947, containing extended versions of the supplement profiles of Brooklyn and Gravesend are also included.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Eagle profiles of Brooklyn's six original towns, ARC.249, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
